Package com.intellij.ui.components

Class JBScrollBar

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JScrollBar
            • com.intellij.ui.components.JBScrollBar
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IdeGlassPane.TopComponent, Interpolable, java.awt.Adjustable, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    GlobalScrollBar, LocalInvisibleScrollBar

    public class JBScrollBar
extends javax.swing.JScrollBar
implements IdeGlassPane.TopComponent, Interpolable
    Our implementation of a scroll bar with the custom UI. Also it provides a method to create custom UI for our custom L&Fs.
    See Also:
    createUI(JComponent), Serialized Form

    • Field Detail

      • TRACK

        public static final Key<RegionPainter<java.lang.Object>> TRACK
        This key defines a region painter, which is used by the custom ScrollBarUI to draw additional paintings (i.e. error stripes) on the scrollbar's track.
        See Also:
        UIUtil.putClientProperty(javax.swing.JComponent, com.intellij.openapi.util.Key<T>, T)

      • LEADING

        public static final java.lang.String LEADING
        This constraint should be used to add a component that will be shown before the scrollbar's track. Note that the previously added leading component will be removed.
        See Also:
        addImpl(Component, Object, int), Constant Field Values

      • TRAILING

        public static final java.lang.String TRAILING
        This constraint should be used to add a component that will be shown after the scrollbar's track. Note that the previously added trailing component will be removed.
        See Also:
        addImpl(Component, Object, int), Constant Field Values

        public static javax.swing.plaf.ScrollBarUI createUI(javax.swing.JComponent c)

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        a new instance of ScrollBarUI

      • getUnitIncrement

        public int getUnitIncrement(int direction)
        Computes the unit increment for scrolling if the viewport's view. Otherwise returns super.getUnitIncrement.
        Overrides:
        getUnitIncrement in class javax.swing.JScrollBar
        Parameters:
        direction - less than zero to scroll up/left, greater than zero for down/right
        Returns:
        an integer, in pixels, containing the unit increment
        See Also:
